div.p: 1 IV:45. Tyber Square— Sun rose 5:45 behind 2d. Tree S. Treasy. Same as 12. Septr.
Storrs Mrs and her Son— soliciting Cadet’s place or Midshipman
Thomas— Jesse B— His opinion of Lincoln of Maine— Gales & Seaton
Smith Joseph L.— About Macon— Complaints and grievances.
Mills— Elijah H— Proceedings of Senate— Precedents— Principles
Clay— H. Reply to Poinsett of 22. Septr. [symbols] Jesup.
Barber. Noyes. With Meml & Papers— Naval Academy New-London
Wilson of Louisiana— Settlement of his Accounts.
Williston— Subscription for 5. Volumes of American Eloquence

row.cell: Resn. on Amendment to Constn. Question taken H.R.
Collector of Champlain district— reccom: A Parsons

div.p: Miss Mease left us— Goes to Mrs Lee’s— Georgetown
Hellen, Johnson. To Rockville— Comes to reside at Washington
2 IV:30. To the River.
3. IV:30. Capitol
Wirt. W. A.G. Sent for Draft reply to Senate on Bissell’s case
Rush S.T— Discussion upon the Draft of reply— to be altered
Brent. Daniel— Answers to Forsyth’s Call
Barbour S.W. Case of Cadet Swift— And Bissell’s. Joness [double Rn]
Hay— George— About Giles and Randolph. Dines here to-morrow.
Niles. H— Visit— Left Randolph invectiving
Geddes. John— T.t.l— going to-morrow— His own dispositions
Webster— of M’Lane’s and Forsyth’s Amendments. Panama Mission
Hellen Johnson, from Rockville— to reside here.
4. V. Capitol.
Test.— about 2 Letters of his relating to Regr. Indianapolis
Rush. S.T— Letter from E. Thompson of R. Cutters
Brent. Daniel— Offley— and Creighton’s claims
Clay S.S.— Rept. on Resn. H.R— for Middleton’s Note of 2 July &c
White Jos. M— Boundary between Georgia and Florida— Macon
Bates— Visitor from Charlestown
Everett. E.— Upon Buchanan’s proposed Resolution
Hay— George— to dine
5. IV:15. Capitol.
Lowrie— Secy Sen—
Cook D. P.
Peck.
Bulfinch—
Dewey.
Caldwell. Dr—
Southard S.N.
Drawing Room— Miss Mease
6 VI— Capitol— Rain
[Sa]nford
Rush S.T.
Garnsey
Rochester.
Metcalfe.
Ward Dewey.
7 IV:15. Capitol
Wirt. A.G— Final draft of Message to Senate on Bissell
[Th]omas— Jesse B
[Sc]ott— John
Rush— S.T.
Clay S.S— despatches from A. H. Everett and R. King.
[symbols] Southard S.N. For Taliaferro as Indian Agent to be transferred.
8. IV:15. Capitol
[Be]ll— Case of Hamtramck
[Slo]ane— With recommendations of J. C. Wright— M’Lane’s Panama Resn.
Barbour S.W. With pro[ceeds] of Court Martial vs Coll. Chambers. Indn. Agency
[To]mlinson— Concerning M’Lane’s Resns. and Surveyor Middletown.
[Ta]liaferro— for his namesake— Indian Agency
[Cob]b— Creek Indians— Project of a New Treaty.
[Sey]mour— Collector at Champlain— Sailly. Palmer— Woodbury’s Letters
[Bre]nt— D.
Rush S.T.
[So]uthard S.N.
Gales of Raleigh
Seaton
9. IV. Capitol.
Heard Little. Acts 17.27.
Dorsey.
Brawner
Thomas Jesse B. [symbols] Macon, Lowrie, Randolph, Benton Noble Ruggles—
Rush— R.
Heard Hawley— Revelations 22.17.
10. IV:45. Capitol— Rain— Snow.
Barbour. S.W— Cobb’s proposals— declined. Coll. Chambers to resign
Brearley— Coll— Creek Indians— reconciln.— Berrien—
Clay. S.S— Note to Salazar— Medn— The meeting.
Hitchcock— Pickens arrived— District Judge Alabama. Crawford. D[ille]t
Barbour. S.W— Answer to Cobb— Hamtramck. Indian Agent. Taliaferro
Southard S.N— Boston Sloop of War to Sail— C. Smith & Bourne
Cook. D. P— Private War at Sea— Secret Laws. Florida. Cuba— Chambers
11. V:35. Sun rose V:32— Clear— Ice.
Sanford— N— Publication by Senate of Executive Communications. Bissell.
Rush. S.T. claim of Judge Scott of Arkansas

row.cell: Visits— Tallmadge Cousin of Lt. Govr

div.p: Barbour S.W.— Hamtramck recomd. Agent to Osage’s— Objections.
Bode— with Dissertn. on Poems of Orpheus.
Merwin— Distt. Judge Connt. Tomlinson. Bristol. Edwards.
Southard— about C. Smith. Stuart’s Sand[wich] Id. Journal. Pettis.
12. V. Capitol— Sun rose 5:31.— George 25. Frost.
Sherburne— Going to-morrow for Portsmouth— Naval Office.
Rush. S.T— Claims for Services in Florida.
Wirt. A.G.— Morning call

row.cell: Marshall Alabama— Crawford for Distt. judge

div.p: Armstrong. Andrew— Treaty of Hayti with France.
Hebb.— for Place— Reference to Dorsey.
Brent. D.— Report on Executive. Appts. during the recess.
[Pe]dersen— from Philadelphia— Instns. for Treaty from his Govt.
Clay S.S. Vaughan’s Decrn agt. Intn. on Slave Convention. Extra Mission.
[symbols]
[13.] IV:15. Capitol Bridge— Sun rose 5:30. S. of S.E edge State Dept. high tree Same as 31. Augt.
[Ar]mstrong. Andrew— Treaty between France and Hayti
Dinsmoor of Alabama— District judge— W. Crawford
Mallary— About C. K. Williams. Bradley— C. P. Van Ness— Panama Mission

row.cell: with Letter from H. G. Burton— Wants to be Commr Banky.

div.p: Pleasonton. S— Light-house keepers— Flaherty to be sent by Rev. Cutter.
Adams— Young man, asks for employment in Patent Office.
[So]uthard. S.N— Sloop of War to cruize on the fishery Coast. Eastport 2 July.

row.cell: from Boston— going tomorrow for St. Louis Missouri

div.p: Brent. D.

row.cell: White declines going to the Florida Indians

div.p: 14. IV:15. Capitol— Rain
Lowrie W.— Resn. S. advising appt. of Paymasters
Rush S.T. Accounts of Claims in Florida Negn. of Land Office
Thomas J. B. Recommg of Hamtramck— Benton’s
Trulock— Mrs Lydia, from Baltimore.
Clay. S.S.— Pedersen’s proposals— Note from Vaughan of Slaves.
Pearce— D. J.— Eveg— Webster’s Speech this day.
15. V: Capitol— Cloudy
Thompson. Alexr— for restoration of Coll Chambers—
Brent. D.— Heap’s Appt. of Consul at Tunis— Salary from Novr 1825.
Hunter John— With recommendns. H.R.U.S. Supt. Indn. Affairs

row.cell: his Son in law recently from the Havana

div.p: Blake— G.— Visit— Elections in Masstts. Panama. Webster’s speech
Clay SS— Note from Vaughan— Slave indemnity. Draft of Answer

row.cell: Appointment of District Judge, in Connecticut

div.p: Williams, from Florida— For place. Register of Land-Office
Bradish— Enquires if Letter from him Const. Decr 1820 was recd.
Everett. E— Returned. Yates, Convention of 1787— Slavery
Pope— N— Debates in S. and H.R. Appt. of Comees. in Senate restored
Dorsey— Clemt— did not see him— Wanted Explann of Message
16. V:30. [symbols]
Heard Little Proverbs 5.22–23. Sarcastic.
Baker— Nahum 1.7.
17. V:15. Sun rose Georgetown
Russell G. C— To plead for restoration of Coll. Chambers.
Brent. D— Note of P.U.S. 6. Octr. 1804. Temporary Commn.
M’Arthur— Genl.— About Judge S.C. from Ohio.
Letcher. Judge of District Court in Kentucky— Boyle.
Van Rensselaer. S. Mrs and Miss.
Roberdeau— Coll. and Misses Mary, Susan and Selina
Mease Miss— Lee. Carter.
Lynch D.— Ouseley Mr— Bradish. Luther— Evening
18. V:30.— After Sun rise— College 1. hour 20 minutes
Lowrie. Resn. Senate— A. Binney rejected.
Bell— Saml— Bissell’s case— Harrison.
Gurley— Recomn: T. B. Robertson Judge S.C. Coll. Chambers
Brent. W. L. Recomn. Porter and Robertson— Coll. Chambers
Williams— of Maryland going to Florida— Regr. Land-Office
Armstrong. Andrew— Hayti Newspapers— Recognition
Brent D.— Answer to Letter Chairman Comee. For. Relns. H.R.
[D]enson Jesse— Application for Appointment as Naval Chaplain
Clay S.S. Treaty Negotiating with Pedersen—
Barbour S.W.— Court-Martial on Coll. Chambers— and Cadle
Rush. S.T. Florida Land-Offices— W. H. Allen and Love

row.cell: With M’Lane’s and Buchanan’s Amendments to the Resn. of expediency for appropriations, for the Panama Mission.

div.p: 19. VI— Met Wood. Walk to Georgetown Bridge
Conner— Benjamin— for papers concerning bridges.
Southard S.N. Nomination of Navy Agent. Boston— [R. D. Harris] for his Son, a Midshipman’s warrant.
Lowry— Revd
Thomas. Jesse B.— The judiciary Bill— arrangemt of Circuits.
Brent— Daniel— for Draft of Convn with Denmark & Heaps Insns.
Barbour S.W. Memorial from Coll. Chambers. Cadle’s Ct. Martial
Clay S.S. Project of Treaty with Denmark. Resns. H.R. Panama
Drawing-room—
20. VI:15. Over Tyber Bridges— Met Wirt.
Mills. E. H.— Upon Branch’s Resn. J. Randolph 7 hours raving.
Brent. D.— Mr Clay’s Answer to Mr Vaughan. Slave-indemnity.
Hunter J. W. with bill for Superintendency of Indian Affairs
Barbour S.W— with Letter from Tattnall about M’Intosh Indians
Warner— from N.Y. for Claimants upon France
Rush. S.T. Thomson’s teas— Josh. Randall assistant Counsel.
Bailey— J— proceedings. H.R. M’Lane & Buchanan 99.95
21: VI:15. Towards Capitol. Met and walked with Bell
Wright. R— Approves Admn. His Son gone Consul to Rio Janyro
Southard S.N— Brandywine arrived at N.Y.
Brent— D— Mr Clay’s Ansr. to Vaughan W. Pinckney & Monroe’s Comn
Gallatin. A— from Baltimore. Will go to England Indn. Vocabulary
Frye— Nl— To ask Mills not to go home
Brown— Genl— Of P.M.G. M’lean’s uneasiness— J. A. Dix
Clay S.S— Convention with Denmark, agreed upon.
[symbols]
22. VI. Tyber Square.
Lowrie— W— Creek Treaty, advised & Resn: Missouri next Session.

row.cell: Visits— Knight Member of Senate Pa. and Surveyor
Sill Member H.R.U.S. in place of Farrelly.
Panama Mission. appropn. Bill H.R. yesterday

div.p: Clary— from New-York— Visitor by curiosity.

row.cell: H.R.U.S. Kentucky— to recommend Tompkins as District judge in place of R. Trimble

div.p: Rush S.T.— Draft of Answer to Jonn. Jennings. copies of his Letters
Barbour S.W. To send away the Creek Indians.

row.cell: Comee. Enrolled Bills— with two Bills—
Lands in Florida— Mississippi and Alabama
To obtain discharge of Joseph Douglas, a coloured boy, from the Brandywine
Son of L. Morris signer of Decn. of Independence
Visits— Angry debate in H.R. upon a Bill to pay for a Negro killed in War. Genl. Jackson

div.p: [To]mlinson— Distt. Judge, Connecticut Recomms for him
[Br]adish— L— Distressed about assertions of Ld. Strangford’s letters
[23] V: Sun rose 5:16. Behind tallest chimney State Dept.
[He]ard Stapler and Wetherall— of the Friends, at the Capitol
[Pos]t at Baker’s. Luke 14.22— And yet there is room
[We]bster here— did not see him— Walk with Wilson.
24. V. Sun rose 5.15. Behind Middle Chimney State Dept.
Same 17. Augt.— Tyber Bridge Square walk.

row.cell: Visits— Hughes returns tomorrow to Baltimore, and is to sail next week for Rotterdam

div.p: Barbour S.W. About the new Creek Treaty

row.cell: Visits— Skinner gave me an invitation to the Cattle Show in June

div.p: Clay S.S. Recommends W. Duane, as Agent to the Havanna
Tutt. C. P with Letter from L— Lee, for an Appointment

row.cell: Visits— Dupont came here on account of his Son’s promotion from Midshipman to Lieutenant—

div.p: Brent D.— For W. Pinkney’s Commission 12 May 1806

row.cell: Visitors— The Woodruffs are from New-Jersey

div.p: Caldwell. Charles— giving Lectures here on phrenology
Brown Genl— Clintonian Caucus Address—
Biddle— Captn— Mentioned death of king of Portugal 9. March
Rush. S.T.— Answer to Jonathan Jennings’s enquiries— Land-Office
At Mr T. B. Johnson’s— Party at [Barr]ells
25. VI. Tyber Square
Francis— From Connecticut— Visitor Self-introduced
Mills— Returned Jenkinson’s Treaties— Going after to-morrow.
Booth— for appointment in Brearley’s place. Navy-Yard.
Mower. Post-Office at New-York— Carrier-boy thief.
Rush. S.T— The Answer to Jennings— Register at Indianapolis
Cobb— Talk about Indian Treaty. Crowell— Cobb going home
Thomas. Judiciary bill, likely to fail N. Pope dissatisfied

row.cell: Visits Donaldson from St. Johns New-Brunswickabout to return there

div.p: White. Jos. M— Regr. & Receiver E. Florida, Commn discontinued
Message to S.U.S.— N. 39— Nominations
Message to H.R.U.S. N. 26.
Land-grants Cincinnati, Ohio 5.

row.cell: Speaking with him of the judiciary bill—interrupted—

div.p: [26]. V. Rain
Brent. D— for draft to Middleton and Letter to [Nicholas] [symbols]
Hunter J. W.— for place of Naval Store-keeper
Rochester— Going to-morrow— Fears summer trip to Panama

row.cell: Announced as Pennsylvania delegation— recommended J. W. Hunter as Naval Store-keeper at Navy Yard

div.p: Barbour S.W. Creek Indian distribution— Crowell not well disposed
[Gre]en Jacob
Webster
[Cl]arke H.R— Resn. for A.G’s opinion upon outfit.
[27.] VI. Central Square.

row.cell: Visits— L. M. Powell a Midshipman, returned from the Mediterranean in the Brandywine
Visits— The General and his family to leave the City next Monday.

div.p: [Ch]ambers. Case of Bissell’s Nomination. Branch’s Resn. Tazewell
[Cl]ay S.S.— Treaty with Denmark. Dix to go special Messenger.
[Opo]thle-Yoholo and deputation of Creek Indians T.T.L.

row.cell: Visitors with Clay— Brady Speaker of the House ofRepresentatives Tennessee— Cochran of Virginia

div.p: 28. VI— Market Square
M’Clain John— Revolutionary Sailor— For Pension
Hunter J. W. with Letter from L. Williams

row.cell: Gamble a Major in the Marine Corps applies for brevet promotion.
For subscription to a Masonic Edifice

div.p: Scott. Alexander— Concg his Son & judge Brackenridge
Rose To recommend C. Selden Navy Store-keeper
Hitchcock— of Alabama— For Crawford as District Judge

row.cell: Visits— Carter recommends Barkley for Marshal Western Distt S.C— N.C. Gold mines.

div.p: Answer to Emperor of Russia, notifying death of Alexander
Commission to [Le]vy Court Washington Co. to 1st. Monday May [1827]
Credential Letter H. Middleton to Nicholas 1—
Message to S.U.S— N. 40. Convention with Denmark.
29. V.— Georgetown.
Miller John— Enquiries concerning nomination of Sailly
Sanford— For Wright’s Letter to Seymour. N.Y. & intl. improve[ment]
Bell— For C. Cutts— Navy Agency Portsmouth— Branch’s Resn.

row.cell: To recommend Dr. Bates as Navy Agent. Boston. Told them Harris was already nominated

div.p: Rush. S.T. Letter from judge Van Ness— Assistant Counsel N.Y.
Lowrie W— 2. Resns. S.U.S. Navy Nominations. Chambers Court [Martial]
Taylor. G.— For Appointment of Navy Agent vice Brearley
Pedersen— Going to Philadelphia. Monday.

row.cell: Visits— Hiester is Surveyor General of the State of Pennsylvania.
Visits— M’Kee is from Wheeling Virginia.
Ruggles resides in Ohio— across the river.

div.p: Wyer— Going tomorrow for St. Petersburg [symbols]
Miller. Thomas— Applicant for Navy Agency— vice Brearley

row.cell: Cabinet Meeting— Instructions to Panama Mission— Payment for Independence— Recognition of Hayti— Canal from Sea to Sea— discussed.

div.p: [Eve]rett E. in the Evening— Judiciary Bill in jeopardy—
[Mrs] A. and girls— Evening party at Mr Rush’s.
Message to H.R. N. 27— Attorney General’s opinion.
[30.] IV:45. Sun rose 5.8. between the two S.W. Chimnies State Dept. Same 13. August.
[Hea]rd Little. Proverbs 3.16. Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
No Church at Baker’s. Met Campbell of Ohio, and Harris of Pa
[Hea]rd Gray at Hawley’s. Matthew 22.42. What think ye of Christ?
B. Bassett. young V. Rensselaer & his Sister there.
[Lee]— W— at Eve— Baron Tuyll died two days after sailing from New York.
[Ta]ylor J. W. fiduciary Bill— Might it not be dispensed with? [dis]agreement between the two Houses.
